history.content:
From what I've heard, logistics are still being finalized and hopefully there will be concrete answers in a week or two, but here's what I know:

1. I don't think discussion attendance is taken, so you can attend a remote one if you want

2. In-person and remote exams will both be offered

3. Not decided yet, but we definitely have commuters in mind

4. Don't think updates to in-person lectures have been discussed yet

children.subject: Yeah, I guess this'll probably still hold, but maybe the latest restrictions will cause this to update

According to the class notes publish in April:

* The in-person lecture will meet in SODA 310 during the same time as the remote lecture. Attendance for the in-person lecture will be first-come, first-seated and those with DSP accommodations for in-person instruction. 

* Once the (adjusted) room capacity is met, all other students will be directed to watch the remote lecture.

history.content:
I have a few questions regarding CS 61C this fall.

Will all students have the option to attend discussions remotely regardless of where they live? Are there any updates on how exams will be held? Can I request to take exams remotely because I live in San Jose and I commute to campus? Due to the delta variant and the indoor mask mandate, will plans for smaller in-person lectures change? It would look weird to be in a classroom with everyone, including the professors, wearing masks.
history.subject: CS 61C Logistics
